intro: Gymnartocarpus woodii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a member of the Fabaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces distinctive, kidney-shaped fruits that are typically green when mature. Gymnartocarpus woodii is known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional African medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological contexts.
